verb.description: (of a bird) move (its wings) up and down when flying or preparing to fly.
examples: gulls flapped around uttering their strange cries

noun.description: A piece of something thin, such as cloth, paper, or metal, hinged or attached only on one side, that covers an opening or hangs down from something.
examples: he pushed through the tent flap

noun.description: A movement of a wing or an arm from side to side or up and down.
examples: the surviving bird made a few final despairing flaps

noun.description: A state of agitation; a panic.
examples: they're in a flap over who's going to take Henry's lectures

noun.description: A type of consonant produced by allowing the tip of the tongue to strike the alveolar ridge very briefly.
